conclusion: The gas is an ideal gas.
The temperature at state C is \( T_C = 300 \, \text{K} \).
The pressure and volume at state C are \( p_C = 4 \times 10^3 \, \text{Pa} \) and \( V_C = 2 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \).
The ideal gas law is given by \( pV = nRT \).

premise: Using the ideal gas law at state C: \( p_C V_C = nR T_C \).
conclusion: Calculate \( nR \) using state C: \( nR = \frac{8}{300} = \frac{4}{150} = \frac{2}{75} \).
At state B: \( p_B = 2 \times 10^3 \, \text{Pa} \) and \( V_B = 4 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \).

premise: Using the ideal gas law at state B: \( p_B V_B = nR T_B \).
The calculated temperature at state B is 300 K.
conclusion: The temperature of the gas in state B is \( 300 \, \text{K} \).
